title.narrative: DECENTRALIZATION AND LOCAL GOVERNANCE -

description.narrative: By 2020, strengthened capacity of Local Governments to maximize the realization and promote equity for children in planning and budgeting processes, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children benefit from evidence based social and economic policies that address multi-dimensional poverty and advance the equitable realization of their rights

title.narrative: By 2020, strengthened capacity of Local Governments to maximize the realization and promote equity for children in planning andbudgeting processes

description.narrative: Decentralization and local governance faced challenges due to complex decentralization processes. To address unclear assignments of competencies between the two provincial bodies, Government conducted a functional analysis, conclusing with recommendations for amendment of laws/decrees to empower the decentralized body and clarify roles between central Government and provincial entities. ;;UNICEF started implementation of memorandums of understanding with the Provincial Assemblies in focus provinces for capacity building;on child-sensitive planning and budgeting, and in collaboration with;a civil society partner, UNICEF supported the "Public Expenditure Tracking Response to COVID-19 with accurate accounts” in Nampula and Zambézia.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2021
